sentences: Fred Mendelsohn (May 16, 1917 â€“ April 28, 2000) was an American music executive.
The president of Savoy Records for 42 years, he was the first man to ever record, promote and market black gospel music as a national company.
Many of today's major gospel artists started on Savoy under the leadership of Mendelsohn.
As a songwriter, he co-wrote, with Rose Marie McCoy, Brown's 1955 hit single "Don't Be Angry".
